meanings.definition: To write more or better than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She outwrote her classmates in the essay competition.
meanings.sent2: The famous author outwrote all others with her latest novel.
meanings.sent3: The student outwrote the teacher in a surprising turn of events.
meanings.sent4: Her pen outwrote the competition, leaving them in awe.
meanings.sent5: With determination, she outwrote her previous record, setting a new standard.

meanings.sent1: He outwrote his peers with his eloquent prose.
meanings.sent2: The poet outwrote all expectations with her heartfelt verses.
meanings.sent3: The novelist outwrote the critics, proving them wrong.
meanings.sent4: Her words outwrote the silence, filling the room with emotion.
meanings.sent5: With each page, he outwrote his doubts, gaining confidence in his craft.
